item.title: ftp server command
item.description:
• use vsftpd(Very Secure FTP Server Daemon)

Installation

# apt install vsftpd

check vsftpd status

# service vsftpd status

check network port

# netstat -natp | grep ftp

Configuration vsftpd

# vi /etc/vsftpd.conf

#/etc/vsftpd.conf
listen=YES
listen_ipv6=NO
anonymous_enable=NO
port_enable=NO
pasv_enable=YES
local_enable=YES
write_enable=YES
use_localtime=YES
xferlog_enable=YES
chroot_local_user=YES
allow_writeable_chroot=YES
secure_chroot_dir=/var/run/vsftpd/empty
pam_service_name=vsftpd
ftpd_banner=Welcom to My FTP Server!
ssl_enable=YES
rsa_cert_file=/etc/ssl/certs/ssl-cert-snakeoil.pem
rsa_private_key=/etc/ssl/private/ssl-cert-snakeoil.key
listen_port=21
pasv_min_port=60020
pasv_max_port=60030
#utf8_filesystem=YES
#local_umask=022
